title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children nodes listed.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed correctly.
SR: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one. Notice that there are no database/table/column information listed. Actual result: No children node listing. Close the data set editor and reopen it to see if the issue persists.
